member.name: T:Geosoft.GX.Controls.AdvancedButtonControl
member.summary: Implements advanced button functionality on derived forms.
member.remarks: By placing this control onto a positioned in the center of the the button will cause the area below the panel to be collapsed when the form is loaded. This button can then be used to automatically expand/collapse the form to reveal more advanced features or hide them.

summary.para: Initializes an instance of the class.

member.name: M:Geosoft.GX.Controls.AdvancedButtonControl.OnLoad(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the event.
member.param: An that contains the event data.

member.name: P:Geosoft.GX.Controls.AdvancedButtonControl.ExpandedState
member.summary: Show a dialog in an expanded or collapsed state

member.name: P:Geosoft.GX.Controls.AdvancedButtonControl.ExpandedStateHeight
member.summary: Get/Modify the Expanded state height. This can be necessary if you hide/show controls in your GX and need to adjust the expanded size to accomodate that.

member.name: P:Geosoft.GX.Controls.AdvancedButtonControl.CollapsedStateHeight
member.summary: Get/Modify the Collapsed state height. This can be necessary if you hide/show controls in your GX and need to adjust the collapsed size to accomodate that.

summary.para: Hides the controls in the advanced region. This ensures, for instance, that the controls are not included in the TAB order when the advanced controls are hidden.

member.name: E:Geosoft.GX.Controls.AdvancedButtonControl.OnExpanded
member.summary: Occurs when the advanced panel is shown. Expanding the panel sets to visible all the controls contained therein, so use this to hide any controls you don't want to be visible when the panel is expanded.

member.name: E:Geosoft.GX.Controls.AdvancedButtonControl.OnHidden
member.summary: Occurs when the advanced panel is hidden.

summary.para: Shows the controls in the advanced region. This ensures, for instance, that the controls are not included in the TAB order when the advanced controls are hidden. The Visible state of the control is reset to its initial value (whether visible or not).

member.name: P:Geosoft.GX.Controls.AdvancedButtonControl.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color for the control.
member.returns: A that represents the background color of the control. The default is the value of the property.

member.summary: Gets or sets the space between controls.
member.returns: A representing the space between controls.

member.name: P:Geosoft.GX.Controls.AdvancedButtonControl.Padding
member.summary: Gets or sets padding within the control.
member.returns: A representing the control's internal spacing characteristics.

member.name: P:Geosoft.GX.Controls.AdvancedButtonControl.MaximumSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size that is the upper limit that can specify.

member.name: M:Geosoft.GX.Controls.ClickThroughExtensions.ClickThroughWndProc(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Windows.Forms.Message@)
member.summary: This WndProc extension method implements click-through functionality. Some controls (MenuStrip, ToolStrip) will not recognize a click unless the form they are hosted in is active. So the first click will activate the form and then a second is required to actually make the click happen.
member.param: The Message that was passed to your WndProc.
The Message that was passed to your WndProc.
member.returns: true if the message was processed, false if it was not
member.remarks: You should first call base.WndProc(), and then call this method. This method is only intended to change a return value, not to change actual processing before that. See: https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/rickbrew/2006/01/09/how-to-enable-click-through-for-net-2-0-toolstrip-and-menustrip/

member.name: T:Geosoft.GX.Controls.ClickThroughMenuStrip

member.summary: Processes Windows messages.

member.name: T:Geosoft.GX.Controls.Helpers.ControlVisibilitySizingHelper
member.summary:
This class listen to the VisibleChanged event of the buddies for a sequence of label controls and will resize the height of the parent container/form and reposition controls as necessary.
It assumes simple top down control organization and will not necessarily work for complex layouts.

member.name: T:Geosoft.GX.Controls.Helpers.CTRHelper
member.summary:
GX.NET controls do not render in Visual Studio the same way that they render in the software, since VS turns off compatible text rendering, but OM does not.
This class is used to selectively disable compatible text rendering.

member.name: M:Geosoft.GX.Controls.Helpers.SWIGAdapter.bColorGui(System.Int32@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Select a colour GUI.
member.param: Ask about C_TRANSPARENT if white is selected>?
member.remarks: Colour value is set on input, and new value returned. If the input colour type is C_TRANSPARENT, then the color is set to white, if any other type is input the output is guaranteed to be of the same type. If the third flag is GS_TRUE is used, then on exit, if white is selected, the user is prompted: 'Do you want white (Yes) or "None" (No) ?' and the colour is converted as requested. If this is not the case, the C_TRANSPARENT is converted to white (if "Ok" is selected) and no choice is offered.

member.name: M:Geosoft.GX.Controls.Helpers.SWIGAdapter.bPatternGui(System.Int32@,System.Double@,System.Int32@,System.Double@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Select a pattern GUI.
member.param: Current Size, input GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.Constant.rDUMMY to use default
Current Thick (0-100), input GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.Constant.iDUMMY to use default
Current Density, input GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.Constant.rDUMMY to use default
Current Background Color, can be C_TRANSPARENT
member.remarks: Pattern values set on input, and new values returned. Solid fill is indicated by Pattern number 0. Size: pattern tile size in mm. Thick: pattern line thickness in percent of the tile size. valid range is 0-100. Density: Tile spacing. A value of 1 means tiles are laid with no overlap. A value of 2 means they overlap each other. The pattern Angle and Style parameters are not user-definable.

member.name: M:Geosoft.GX.Controls.Helpers.SWIGAdapter.RenderPattern(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Renders a Geosoft pattern to a Windows DC.
member.param: left value of the render rect in Windows coordinates (bottom>top)
pattern Size, input GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.Constant.rDUMMY to use default
pattern Thick (0-100), input GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.Constant.iDUMMY to use default
pattern Density, input GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.Constant.rDUMMY to use default
pattern Background Color, can be C_TRANSPARENT

member.name: M:Geosoft.GX.Controls.Helpers.SWIGAdapter.GetDATDefaults(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Return the user default extension and qualifier for grids/images.
member.remarks: The default grid/image filters are normally stored in "MONTAJ.DEFAULT_XGD_IN" and "MONTAJ.DEFAULT_XGD_OUT" If no filter is defined, or the filter is not found then "grd" and "GRD" are returned as the default extension and qualifier.

member.name: M:Geosoft.GX.Controls.Helpers.SWIGAdapter.GetFileFilter(System.Int32,System.String@,System.String@,System.String@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Return the defined filter, mask, extension and directory for an input filter.
member.remarks: Returns the four parts of the file filter; e.g. for FILE_FILTER_GDB it returns: Filter: "Database (*.gdb)" Mask: "*.gdb" Extension: "gdb" Directory: "GS_DIRECTORY_NONE" This function is useful for constuction open/save dialog file filters, especially in GX.Net functions.

member.name: T:Geosoft.GX.Controls.DragDropListBox
member.summary: ListBox which provides a fully integrated drag-and-drop functionality, which also works when multiple ListBox items are selected (multiselect). Items can be moved and copied between different DragDropListBoxes or can be moved inside of one DragDropListBox in order to be reordered. Drag-and-drop works also with or types of controls implementing IDragDropSource.
member.remarks: Provides additional properties for the fine-tuning of the drag-and-drop behavior in the section "Behavior (drag-and-drop)" of the properties window of the form designer.

member.name: M:Geosoft.GX.Controls.DragDropListBox.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Geosoft.GX.Controls.DragDropListBox.DragDropGroup
member.summary: Drag-and-drop group to which the control belongs. Drag-and-drop is restricted to happen between controls having the same DragDropGroup.
member.example: Let's assume that we have a form with four DragDropListBoxes on it. Two of them contain cats and two of them contain dogs. We only want to be able to move cats between the cat lists and dogs between the dog lists (cats and dogs don't like each other). We can achieve this simply by setting the DragDropGroup property of the cat lists to "cats". In the dog lists we can leave the DragDropGroup empty or we can set it to "dogs" for instance. It just has to be different from the DragDropGroup in the cat lists. catList1.DragDropGroup = "cats"; catList2.DragDropGroup = "cats";

member.name: P:Geosoft.GX.Controls.DragDropListBox.IsDragDropCopySource
member.summary: Indicates whether the user can copy items from this control by draging them to another control.

member.name: P:Geosoft.GX.Controls.DragDropListBox.IsDragDropMoveSource
member.summary: Indicates whether the user can remove items from this control by draging them to another control.

member.name: M:Geosoft.GX.Controls.DragDropListBox.GetSelectedItems
member.summary: Returns the selected list items in a array.

member.summary: Removes the selected items from the list and adjusts the item-index passed to this method, so that this index points to the same item afterwards.

member.name: M:Geosoft.GX.Controls.DragDropListBox.OnDropped(Geosoft.GX.Controls.DroppedEventArgs)
member.summary: Is called when a drag-and-drop operation is completed in order to raise the Dropped event.
member.param: Event arguments which hold information on the completed operation.
member.remarks: Is called for the target as well as for the source. The role a control plays (source or target) can be determined from e.Operation.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can edit the list items.

member.name: M:Geosoft.GX.Controls.DragDropListBox.DropIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the index of the item before which items are being dropped. The index is calculated from the vertical position of the mouse. If the drop position lies after the last item in the list, then the index of the last item + 1 (which is equal to Item.Count) is returned instead.

member.returns: Index of an item in the list or Items.Count

member.name: T:Geosoft.GX.Controls.VisualCue
member.summary: Horizontal line, which indicates the current drop position.
member.remarks: In order to be able to delete the visual cue properly, we need to draw in inverted mode. Since Microsoft has not included this option into the BCL, we need to fall back on the Win32 API.

member.summary: Indicates that no visual cue has been drawn.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the VisualCue class.

member.summary: Clears the visual cue, if some visual cue is visible.

member.name: M:Geosoft.GX.Controls.VisualCue.Draw(System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws a visual cue before (above) the list item indicated by itemIndex. If itemIndex is greater than the index of the last item of the list, then the visual cue is drawn after (below) the last list item.
member.remarks: Remembers the passed index for later use by the Clear method and for the Index property.

member.name: M:Geosoft.GX.Controls.BaseControl.bColorGui(System.Int32@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Select a colour GUI.
member.param: Ask about C_TRANSPARENT if white is selected>?
member.remarks: Colour value is set on input, and new value returned. If the input colour type is C_TRANSPARENT, then the color is set to white. If the third flag is GS_TRUE is used, then on exit, if white is selected, the user is prompted: 'Do you want white (Yes) or "None" (No) ?' and the colour is converted as requested. If this is not the case, the C_TRANSPARENT is converted to white (if "Ok" is selected) and no choice is offered.

member.name: M:Geosoft.GX.Controls.BaseControl.bPatternGui(System.Int32@,System.Double@,System.Int32@,System.Double@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Select a pattern GUI.
member.param: Current Size, input Constant.rDUMMY to use default
Current Thick (0-100), input Constant.iDUMMY to use default
Current Density, input Constant.rDUMMY to use default
Current Background Color, can be C_TRANSPARENT
member.remarks: Pattern values set on input, and new values returned. Solid fill is indicated by Pattern number 0. Size: pattern tile size in mm. Thick: pattern line thickness in percent of the tile size. valid range is 0-100. Density: Tile spacing. A value of 1 means tiles are laid with no overlap. A value of 2 means they overlap each other. The pattern Angle and Style parameters are not user-definable.

member.name: M:Geosoft.GX.Controls.BaseControl.RenderPattern(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Renders a Geosoft pattern to a Windows DC.
member.param: left value of the render rect in Windows coordinates (bottom>top)
pattern Size, input Constant.rDUMMY to use default
pattern Thick (0-100), input Constant.iDUMMY to use default
pattern Density, input Constant.rDUMMY to use default
pattern Background Color, can be C_TRANSPARENT

member.summary: Return the user default extension and qualifier for grids/images.
member.remarks: The default grid/image filters are normally stored in "MONTAJ.DEFAULT_XGD_IN" and "MONTAJ.DEFAULT_XGD_OUT" If no filter is defined, or the filter is not found then "grd" and "GRD" are returned as the default extension and qualifier.

member.name: M:Geosoft.GX.Controls.BaseControl.GetFileFilter(System.Int32,System.String@,System.String@,System.String@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Return the defined filter, mask, extension and directory for an input filter.
member.remarks: Returns the four parts of the file filter; e.g. for FILE_FILTER_GDB it returns: Filter: "Database (*.gdb)" Mask: "*.gdb" Extension: "gdb" Directory: "GS_DIRECTORY_NONE" This function is useful for constuction open/save dialog file filters, especially in GX.Net functions.

summary.para: Modeless Forms in .Net is arguably broken in the sense that one cannot tab between controls within the form and that the controls' with focus is not painted with cues to this effect.

Another issue is that if these forms are used within a native application the main window (or its last active popup) is not activated as soon as a modeless child is closed. It seems that the last active desktop application is activated and this causes usability issues.
This class is derived from and implements workarounds for these two issues. Unless the form is shown modelessly

member.name: M:Geosoft.GX.Controls.FileEditControl.SetFilePath(System.String)
member.summary: Set the file path value in an FEdit control.

remarks.para: The input string is a Geosoft path, and may contain multiple files (if you are using the multiple file option) or qualifiers (for grid and image DATs). The volume and directory parts are options, with the current workspace directory assumed.
The path is automatically split, so that only the file name(s) and qualifier appears in the text edit box.
The input can be a replaceable parameter in the form %FILE%, for instance you can input %MONTAJ.DEFAULT_COLOUR% to set the default colour table.

member.name: M:Geosoft.GX.Controls.FileEditControl.SetDefaultFilePath(System.String)
member.summary: Set a default path for first-time use of new filter for a multi-filter dialog, so that the underlying can deduce the selected filter index by inspecing the file name. This cannot be set to the ini parameter as in SetFilePath which doesn't exist for such a filter that has never been used.

member.name: M:Geosoft.GX.Controls.FileEditControl.bIsValid(System.String@)
member.summary: Check to see if the current file path passes validation tests.
member.remarks:
The following validation is performed:
The file name(s) must not contain illegal characters.
If the control is opened using Constant.FILE_FORM_OPEN, the the file(s) must exist.
If the control is opened using Constant.FILE_FORM_SAVE, permission must have been given for overwriting.
If the item is required, it must be defined.
member.param: The returned error string if the control does not validate.

member.name: M:Geosoft.GX.Controls.IAPIAdapter.bColorGui(System.Int32@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Select a colour GUI.
member.param: Ask about C_TRANSPARENT if white is selected>?
member.remarks: Colour value is set on input, and new value returned. If the input colour type is C_TRANSPARENT, then the color is set to white, if any other type is input the output is guaranteed to be of the same type. If the third flag is GS_TRUE is used, then on exit, if white is selected, the user is prompted: 'Do you want white (Yes) or "None" (No) ?' and the colour is converted as requested. If this is not the case, the C_TRANSPARENT is converted to white (if "Ok" is selected) and no choice is offered.

member.name: M:Geosoft.GX.Controls.IAPIAdapter.bPatternGui(System.Int32@,System.Double@,System.Int32@,System.Double@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Select a pattern GUI.
member.param: Current Size, input Constant.rDUMMY to use default
Current Thick (0-100), input Constant.iDUMMY to use default
Current Density, input Constant.rDUMMY to use default
Current Background Color, can be C_TRANSPARENT
member.remarks: Pattern values set on input, and new values returned. Solid fill is indicated by Pattern number 0. Size: pattern tile size in mm. Thick: pattern line thickness in percent of the tile size. valid range is 0-100. Density: Tile spacing. A value of 1 means tiles are laid with no overlap. A value of 2 means they overlap each other. The pattern Angle and Style parameters are not user-definable.

member.name: M:Geosoft.GX.Controls.IAPIAdapter.RenderPattern(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Renders a Geosoft pattern to a Windows DC.
member.param: left value of the render rect in Windows coordinates (bottom>top)
pattern Size, input Constant.rDUMMY to use default
pattern Thick (0-100), input Constant.iDUMMY to use default
pattern Density, input Constant.rDUMMY to use default
pattern Background Color, can be C_TRANSPARENT

member.summary: Return the user default extension and qualifier for grids/images.
member.remarks: The default grid/image filters are normally stored in "MONTAJ.DEFAULT_XGD_IN" and "MONTAJ.DEFAULT_XGD_OUT" If no filter is defined, or the filter is not found then "grd" and "GRD" are returned as the default extension and qualifier.

member.name: M:Geosoft.GX.Controls.IAPIAdapter.GetFileFilter(System.Int32,System.String@,System.String@,System.String@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Return the defined filter, mask, extension and directory for an input filter.
member.remarks: Returns the four parts of the file filter; e.g. for FILE_FILTER_GDB it returns: Filter: "Database (*.gdb)" Mask: "*.gdb" Extension: "gdb" Directory: "GS_DIRECTORY_NONE" This function is useful for constuction open/save dialog file filters, especially in GX.Net functions.

member.name: M:Geosoft.GX.Controls.EditIntControl.iGetValue
member.summary: Get the value from the edit box, interpreted as an integer.
member.remarks: Validation by range is not performed. Use the Edit.bIsValid() function.
member.returns: The integer value of the displayed text. If the value cannot be interpreted as an integer, or if the field is empty, then the returned value is GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.Constant.iDUMMY.

member.name: M:Geosoft.GX.Controls.EditIntControl.bIsValid(System.String@)
member.summary: Check to see if the current edit text box item passes valiation tests.
member.param: Error string return describing failure (if any)
member.remarks:
The following validation is performed:
If the item is required, it must be defined.
If the item is an integer or real value, it must be interpretable as such.
If a numeric range is defined, the value must be within the range.

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_CYFULLSCREEN

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_CXMINTRACK
member.summary: Minimum tracking width of a window, in pixels. The user cannot drag the window frame to a size smaller than these dimensions. A window can override this value by processing the WM_GETMINMAXINFO message.

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_CYMINTRACK

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_CXDOUBLECLK
member.summary: Width of the rectangle around the location of a first click in a double-click sequence, in pixels. The second click must occur within the rectangle defined by SM_CXDOUBLECLK and SM_CYDOUBLECLK for the system to consider the two clicks a double-click

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_CYDOUBLECLK
member.summary: Height of the rectangle around the location of a first click in a double-click sequence, in pixels. The second click must occur within the rectangle defined by SM_CXDOUBLECLK and SM_CYDOUBLECLK for the system to consider the two clicks a double-click. (The two clicks must also occur within a specified time.)

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_CXICONSPACING
member.summary: Width of a grid cell for items in large icon view, in pixels. Each item fits into a rectangle of size SM_CXICONSPACING by SM_CYICONSPACING when arranged. This value is always greater than or equal to SM_CXICON

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_CYICONSPACING
member.summary: Height of a grid cell for items in large icon view, in pixels. Each item fits into a rectangle of size SM_CXICONSPACING by SM_CYICONSPACING when arranged. This value is always greater than or equal to SM_CYICON.

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_MENUDROPALIGNMENT

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_CYMAXIMIZED
member.summary: Default height, in pixels, of a maximized top-level window on the primary display monitor.

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_NETWORK
member.summary: Least significant bit is set if a network is present; otherwise, it is cleared. The other bits are reserved for future use

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_CLEANBOOT
member.summary: Value that specifies how the system was started: 0-normal, 1-failsafe, 2-failsafe /w net

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_CXDRAG
member.summary: Width of a rectangle centered on a drag point to allow for limited movement of the mouse pointer before a drag operation begins, in pixels.

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_CYDRAG
member.summary: Height of a rectangle centered on a drag point to allow for limited movement of the mouse pointer before a drag operation begins. This value is in pixels. It allows the user to click and release the mouse button easily without unintentionally starting a drag operation.

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_SHOWSOUNDS
member.summary: Nonzero if the user requires an application to present information visually in situations where it would otherwise present the information only in audible form; zero otherwise.

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_CXMENUCHECK
member.summary: Width of the default menu check-mark bitmap, in pixels.

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_CYMENUCHECK
member.summary: Height of the default menu check-mark bitmap, in pixels.

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_SLOWMACHINE
member.summary: Nonzero if the computer has a low-end (slow) processor; zero otherwise

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_MIDEASTENABLED
member.summary: Nonzero if the system is enabled for Hebrew and Arabic languages, zero if not.

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_MOUSEPRESENT
member.summary: Nonzero if a mouse is installed; zero otherwise. This value is rarely zero, because of support for virtual mice and because some systems detect the presence of the port instead of the presence of a mouse.

member.summary: Windows 2000 (v5.0+) Coordinate of the top of the virtual screen

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_YVIRTUALSCREEN
member.summary: Windows 2000 (v5.0+) Coordinate of the left of the virtual screen

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_CYVIRTUALSCREEN
member.summary: Windows 2000 (v5.0+) Height of the virtual screen

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_CMONITORS
member.summary: Number of display monitors on the desktop

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_SAMEDISPLAYFORMAT
member.summary: Windows XP (v5.1+) Nonzero if all the display monitors have the same color format, zero otherwise. Note that two displays can have the same bit depth, but different color formats. For example, the red, green, and blue pixels can be encoded with different numbers of bits, or those bits can be located in different places in a pixel's color value.

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_IMMENABLED
member.summary: Windows XP (v5.1+) Nonzero if Input Method Manager/Input Method Editor features are enabled; zero otherwise

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_CXFOCUSBORDER
member.summary: Windows XP (v5.1+) Width of the left and right edges of the focus rectangle drawn by DrawFocusRect. This value is in pixels.

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_CYFOCUSBORDER
member.summary: Windows XP (v5.1+) Height of the top and bottom edges of the focus rectangle drawn by DrawFocusRect. This value is in pixels.

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_TABLETPC
member.summary: Nonzero if the current operating system is the Windows XP Tablet PC edition, zero if not.

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_MEDIACENTER
member.summary: Nonzero if the current operating system is the Windows XP, Media Center Edition, zero if not.

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_CMETRICS_OTHER
member.summary: Metrics Other

member.summary: Metrics Windows NT

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_REMOTESESSION
member.summary: Windows XP (v5.1+) This system metric is used in a Terminal Services environment. If the calling process is associated with a Terminal Services client session, the return value is nonzero. If the calling process is associated with the Terminal Server console session, the return value is zero. The console session is not necessarily the physical console - see WTSGetActiveConsoleSessionId for more information.

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_SHUTTINGDOWN
member.summary: Windows XP (v5.1+) Nonzero if the current session is shutting down; zero otherwise

member.name: F:Geosoft.GX.Controls.NativeMethods.SystemMetric.SM_REMOTECONTROL
member.summary: Windows XP (v5.1+) This system metric is used in a Terminal Services environment. Its value is nonzero if the current session is remotely controlled; zero otherwise

member.name: T:Geosoft.GX.Controls.PanelControl
member.summary: Implements a convenient panel for placement on derived forms.
member.remarks: Normally this control acts as a container for the OK and Cancel controls. One can also place a this control onto it and position it in the center of the and the button will cause the area below the panel to be collapsed when the form is loaded. The button can then be used to automatically expand/collapse the form to reveal more advanced features or hide them.

The pattern line thick in percent of the tile size 0-100
The pattern tile spacing. A value of 1 means tiles are laid with no overlap. A value of 2 means they overlap each other.

member.name: T:PopupControl.PopupAnimations
member.summary: Types of animation of the pop-up window.

member.name: F:PopupControl.PopupAnimations.None
member.summary: Uses no animation.

member.name: F:PopupControl.PopupAnimations.LeftToRight
member.summary: Animates the window from left to right. This flag can be used with roll or slide animation.

member.name: F:PopupControl.PopupAnimations.RightToLeft
member.summary: Animates the window from right to left. This flag can be used with roll or slide animation.

member.name: F:PopupControl.PopupAnimations.TopToBottom
member.summary: Animates the window from top to bottom. This flag can be used with roll or slide animation.

member.name: F:PopupControl.PopupAnimations.BottomToTop
member.summary: Animates the window from bottom to top. This flag can be used with roll or slide animation.

member.name: F:PopupControl.PopupAnimations.Center
member.summary: Makes the window appear to collapse inward if it is hiding or expand outward if the window is showing.

member.name: F:PopupControl.PopupAnimations.Slide
member.summary: Uses a slide animation.

member.name: F:PopupControl.PopupAnimations.Blend
member.summary: Uses a fade effect.

member.name: F:PopupControl.PopupAnimations.Roll
member.summary: Uses a roll animation.

member.name: F:PopupControl.PopupAnimations.SystemDefault
member.summary: Uses a default animation.
